item.title: Jerome add a quote by Robert Graves
item.description: "There's no money in poetry, but there's no poetry in money, either." -- Robert Graves

item.title: Jerome add a quote by Erick S. Gray
item.description: "Whatever you give a woman, she will make greater. If you give her sperm, she'll give you a baby.. If you give her a house, she'll give you a home. If you give her groceries, she'll give you a meal. If you give her a smile, she'll give you her heart. She multiplies and enlarges what is given to her. So, if you give her any crap, be ready to receive a ton of shit!" -- Erick S. Gray

item.title: Jerome add a quote by Nick Joaquín
item.description: "The point is not how we use a tool, but how it uses us." -- Nick Joaquín

item.title: Jerome add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "It is amazing how complete is the delusion that beauty is goodness." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Jerome add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Jerome add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Jerome add a quote by Patricia Nell Warren
item.description: "The angel of death had cruised him. Death, that hustler, that last lover." -- Patricia Nell Warren

item.title: Jerome add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "Those who dream by day are cognizant of many things which escape those who dream only by night." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Jerome add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "They who can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Jerome add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "Of all forms of caution, caution in love is perhaps the most fatal to true happiness." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Jerome add a quote by Linda Grayson
item.description: "There is nothing better than a friend, unless it is a friend with chocolate." -- Linda Grayson

item.title: Jerome add a quote by Edward Albee
item.description: "What I mean by an educated taste is someone who has the same tastes that I have." -- Edward Albee

item.title: Jerome add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Jerome add a quote by Douglas Coupland
item.description: "Remember: the time you feel lonely is the time you most need to be by yourself. Life's cruelest irony." -- Douglas Coupland

item.title: Jerome add a quote by Louis L'Amour
item.description: "Start writing, no matter what. The water does not flow until the faucet is turned on." -- Louis L'Amour
